intro: Ockea, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Ockea species are often found in regions of southern Africa, where they thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale yellow, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
